thread.title: Kirsten Dunst’s SAG Awards dress proves this trend is coming back for good
thread.title_full: Kirsten Dunst’s SAG Awards dress proves this trend is coming back for good

author: Stephanie Hallett
title: Kirsten Dunst’s SAG Awards dress proves this trend is coming back for good
text:
Kirsten Dunst’s SAG Awards dress proves this trend is coming back for good Perhaps she was channeling her inner Marie Antoinette — a character she once played on film! — but Kirsten Dunst’s SAG Awards gown is definitive proof that the bustier dress is back, and it’s not going away anytime soon.
Wearing a decidedly bridal-esque frothy white dotted tulle gown by Dior — complete with crystal-encrusted straps — Dunst worked the red carpet like a pro . Always keen to put her own edgy twist on a demure, ultra-feminine look, Dunst pair her dress with loose waves, a bold red lip, and layered diamond necklaces, adding a bit of spice to an otherwise ethereal ensemble.
David Crotty/Patrick McMullan via Getty Images So romantic! 
The bustier dress has been cropping up on red carpets for months now, and we’re more than on board with the trend. Stars like Dunst are proving that a modern take on this Victorian garment (slash short-lived 2000s trend ) can be fashionable — and far less painful to wear than in centuries past!
At the SAG Awards, actress Natalia Dyer — who plays Nancy Wheeler on Stranger Things — also worked the red carpet in a bustier dress by Miu Miu .
Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic Slay , queen! 

Earlier this month, Kristen Bell worked a bustier jumpsuit at the People’s Choice Awards, pairing her ensemble with beachy waves much like Dunst’s.
Allen Berezovsky/Getty Images for Fashion Media And in November last year, at the 2016 Angel Ball honoring her late father Robert Kardashian, Kourtney Kardashian wore a statement-making bustier frock with oval cutouts on the thighs.
John Lamparski/WireImage Talk about trend-setting!
While bustiers, which feature cups that push the breasts up and together, might not be comfortable for everyone, we’re liking the remixed versions of this look that we’ve seen in Hollywood recently.
